review_text: The property was pristine beautiful lots of flowers grass and small orchard good views and Deannaâ€™s family was very nice. Unfortunately there was no internet or wifi upon arrival due to a recent provider change. Deanna did try to resolve the wifi issue. Iâ€™m sure this will be fixed for future guests it was just bad timing. The accommodation was comfortable good ac and fan to keep it cool when needed. No kitchen as advertised set up was basic like a hotel room with small microwave, small bar fridge and coffee pods /kettle. Paper plates. The bed was comfy and had nice linens. Bathroom/shower was spacious. I liked the location being only a few minutes down highway from shops etc however this property overlooks the highway and traffic noise was constant. There is also a fairly busy road in back of property. Overall I enjoyed my stay in Wenatchee and was decent for two nights.

We had a one year old with us who's pack and play fit well in the room. We liked that there are no shared walls, so if she fussed there was no stress. When asked for recommendations for places to eat in town, Deanne was ready with them. It was great that we had our own assigned parking space, and the neighborhood feels very safe. The view from the bedroom window was incredible. The drive from the main area to get there, no problems. If we ski mission ridge again, we would book this again!

Â·
June 2022
,
Â·
Stayed about a week
review_text: Nice little spot to stay. It is in East Wenatchee a bit south of all the businesses. Access to the highway that leads into town is very quick and easy. The room itself is designed for one guest or a couple. It is equipped with a queen size bed, a small table and two chairs. There is a microwave and a mini fridge, but otherwise, no kitchen. It is modern and clean and off the road a bit, so parking is semi-private. The window looks out onto some mature cherry trees, but unless you go outside, there is no real view. Outside, there are a couple chairs you can sit on for your morning coffee. From there you can get a small view of the hills to the west and a little piece of the river. The hosts were very responsive and friendly. We would rent there again if and when we return.

Deanneâ€™s place was a perfect weekend mini-getaway. The space is clean and I appreciated the reserved parking spot! The place is also close to downtown Wenatchee (less than 10 min). I also did some hiking at nearby (20-25 min drive) Squilchuck State Park and Mission Ridge.
Deanne was so courteous to allow a later check-out. I got to take my time exploring the trails because she let me stay a little longer. â˜ºï¸
The drive from and back to Seattle was gorgeous this early May. I canâ€™t imagine how much more beautiful the orchards will be once the blossoms and fruit come in! And gosh, any drive through the mountains (weather permitting) is heaven.
Thank you Deanne for allowing me this weekend to rest and recoup!

There is a house directly across the bathroom window and if you have your light on at night, they get a straight view into the bathroom as well as right to your bed if the bathroom door is left open. It could also be a bit cleanlier, as there was a spider greeting me as soon as I walked in, as well as spider webs along the bathroom door corners. Other than that, this is a nice value for the money and a great location. Itâ€™s definitely a cozy and quiet stay. Would recommend.

Staying at Brettâ€™s Airbnb was an exceptional experience that truly exceeded my expectations. I was thoroughly impressed by how Brett has transformed this 1900s house into a modern haven while retaining its original character. The attention to detail in the restoration is evident, and it made my stay feel both unique and nostalgic.
From the moment I stepped in, the cleanliness of the place stood out. Itâ€™s clear that Brett goes above and beyond to ensure the space is spotless and inviting. The house was equipped with all the amenities one could need, making it feel like a home away from home.
Brett as a host was amazing. His friendly demeanor and eagerness to ensure my stay was comfortable made a significant difference.
In summary, this Airbnb is a gem that I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a comfortable, clean, and unique place to stay. Brett has done an outstanding job with the house, and his hospitality is unmatched. A 5-star experience through and through!

review_text: Brett was very friendly and welcomed us with provided coffee and A/C units in each room for comfort which was greatly appreciated (even though we had colder weather than we anticipated). The house is cute and we had a nice stay. They had clearly vacuumed though it didnâ€™t seem as clean as I expected. There were crumbs and old drips of things from other people on the kitchen floor. They had air fresheners but they got to be too strong. After taking a couple air fresheners out we immediately smelled dog on the carpet and couch and plugged them back in. Not much by way of kitchen pantry supplies, so if youâ€™re looking to cook, bring or buy your own. Luckily there is a grocery store very close by. The beds were firm, but I thought mine was quite comfy and they had several pillows to use. When I booked, I guess I didnâ€™t realize they lived below, so waking up to them making noises (seemed like closing drawers/doors kinda loudly) was a little disappointing. Iâ€™m sure they heard us too though.

March 2024
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The Pros:
*It is close to Mission Ridge Ski Area.
*The beds were comfortable, the heat worked well, it had tall ceilings, and feels spacious.
*Check-in and check-out were easy.
The Cons:
*The oven doesn't work. It is damaged so that it only offers "stay warm" and "convection" ... the convection doesn't heat to the appropriate temp and only cooks to warm, not hot. We had to use the microwave to finish heating our meal that was designed to bake. The reason we use Airbnb vs a hotel room is so that we can cook our meals when we are done skiing. The control panel of the oven is clearly damaged, there is no way that the host doesn't know it's melted and doesn't work.
*limited comfortable furniture to kick back and watch a movie. One couch and chair are comfortable, the other two chairs are not as comfortable.
*The living room TV is small, only 40", and difficult to watch a movie as a family
The description is not accurate, it was disappointing to discover the oven wasn't working.

review_text:
My husband & I stayed here for two nights of concerts at The Gorge Amphitheatre. (It's 45-75 minutes away, depending on traffic, in case you're wondering.) While the instructions to get there are pretty clear, I would highly suggest arriving during daylight hours so that you've done the drive at least once before you try to navigate it in the dark.
I was hesitant to stay in a place where the host is on-site, but I never once saw them. Their cute dog came to visit a few times during our morning grounding sessions in the grass & coffee on the patio. . .& we could hear them upstairs at times, but nothing obtrusive.
We unfortunately missed sunrise & sunset from the patio, but I imagine it would be gorgeous. It's peaceful & serene. . .& you can even hear cows mooing on the hillside.
Unit description & pictures are accurate. Good communication with the hosts. . .& easy peasy check-in & check-out procedures.

Cassy and Jasonâ€™s place is great for a little getaway in the area. Itâ€™s not far from the heart of Wenatchee, but tucked into the foothills for that out of town feel. We really enjoyed having breakfast out there in the mornings.
Wifi was good, and easy to log into. Kitchen was well equipped. Beds were comfortable. The owners actually live upstairs (but we hardly heard them at all), and their adorable dog came down a few times to visit us. Probably my daughterâ€™s favorite part, being a puppy lover. ğŸ¶ Itâ€™s about 35 minutes to Leavenworth, but a beautiful drive with several fun stops along the way (be sure to check out the Aplets and Cotlets candy factory in Cashmere). It was perfect for our Girls getaway. We definitely recommend this place. Thanks for hosting us Cassy and Jason!

I thought this place was a great deal and accurately described - the room is tiny but the ad/pictures are clear and it was warm, clean and comfortable. The hosts were friendly and gave helpful check-in directions that saved me from blundering around in the dark. Lots of fun cats (I was amused by trying to distinguish between them in the dark or count how many cats there were, lol). It's basically a bonus/kid's bedroom in a big mountain ranch house. Perfect place for a solo ski trip.
I didn't encounter anything pushy or uncomfortable around religion, lifestyle etc., no one brought up anything like that (just noting bc I shared some people's concerns about decorations, but it's decoration, de gustibus etc.) and the hosts were interesting and friendly to me despite me probably seeming like a crazy person because of a hectic week of work and getting up there.
May be better to ski Mission Ridge from here? Really appreciate you guys and would love to stay again.

,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text: I was in town for my aunt's funeral. So it's not the happiest reason to be at a place. My stay was good. I received clear instructions on how to check-in. The ranch and the house were lovely. There is a pleasing view from the breakfast nook. It was a nice way to start the day. What I needed was a bed, a bathroom, and a light breakfast. That's exactly what I got, plus some added bonuses. The cats were very friendly and a joy to pet. I loved seeing the horses and goats around the property. The view out the window of Little Eiger Room is the patio with a waterfall. It's calming. The room is small, but perfect for one person. There is a single bed, a petite desk, a chest of drawers, and they have a monitor set up with movies available on it. I did not watch any movies, but it was nice to know I could. There is a shared bathroom. I was the only guest for the night, so sharing didn't come into play. As others have commented, if you are staying during snowy months, you will need a 4x4 vehicle.

I woke up to deer in the pasture, baby billy goats, and little chicks. The house is huge and very nice and clean. The hosts were super friendly and offered to give me rides while my truck was being worked on in Cashmere. I thought that they were way above and beyond any expectations I had. I highly recommend staying here!

name: Rachel
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
April 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I'm so thankful that I ended up staying here while I was working in the area! While I didn't get to meet Heidi in person until halfway into my stay as she was away for a few days, she was very communicative by cell phone and made herself available for any questions. In the interim, her cats were excellent hosts, as was her husband Martin. :) He is early to rise, and I was able to chat with him about life on the ranch before heading to work.
Regarding the room, it is perfect for a solo traveler with a single bed, dresser for clothes, and a desk at which to work. The wifi made it easy to get online work done, and the coffee from the coffee bar did too. Heidi made sure to add little touches throughout her home for guests, from the Keurig coffee maker, to grab and go cereal bars and oatmeal, to fresh tangelos to break your morning fast with. The shared bathroom and room were spotless, and the communal areas were very tidy.
I highly recommend staying here if you get the chance! It's a lovely retreat if you're a solo traveler looking to stay connected to the outside world but get a taste of the country, and Heidi, Martin, and their cats are solidly amazing people to get to know. Hope to see you guys again soon!

review_text: The bedroom is super small. I felt like I was in a closet than a bedroom. I didn't have that much room to put my things. The bed was OK since it's a one person fold out chair. It could have been a lot worse since she added extra padding. I barely fit on the bed length wise since I am 5'11. It didn't bother me that much since I am used to sleeping on a shorter mattress. I loved the coffee bar. She actually had snacks and candy for her guests. She had a good selection of tea and coffee. In addition, she had hot chocolate and hot apple cider. The mini-fridge was clean and worked like a charm. The bathroom and shower were clean too. I love her cats!! She has six cats that come inside at night. Some of them are very friendly and want to be petted. The room was at a great price for the accommodations. It was a nice place to stay after working all day. I would stay there again.

Stoller Ranch is a beautiful place to stay. The drive in is a bit long, but definitely worth it! The home itself is gorgeous and very homey. The animals are friendly, the sky is gorgeous at sunset, and the stars are all bright at nighttime.
Heidi is a wonderful host who is friendly and hospitable in every way. The coffee bar she provides is above and beyond. Coffee, fresh fruit, and breakfast bars and much more. She also has tons of brochures and advice for what to do around the area which is super helpful.
This room was a good size for me personally but may not be for everyone as the bed is quite small as she mentions in the listing. The bed itself was decent, but if I were to stay again for more than one night I would definitely book a different room in her house.
There's a small fridge and microwave to use in the common area, but note that there is no kitchen access so it is probably better for a shorter stay unless you plan on eating out for most meal.

The listing is accurate to a point. It is very cute and "cozy" as the title says. Not sure where the "breakfast" part of "Bed and Breakfast" was. There were 2 packets of oatmeal available so maybe that was it... It says no TV but want to make sure people know that. I missed that on the listing. Not a big deal but was expecting to be able to wind down the evening with some news.
My biggest issue was that there was NO SHOWER. The listing does not say that there was one but I assumed there was. There is only a very cute tub. I am a big boy and a tub is not feasible for me. I also can wash my hair when I am trying to rinse in water that my body stewed in. Game changer for me. NO SHOWER

What a gem! Traci's place exceeded our expectations. From the "turn down" service she provided because we were arriving very late in the evening to all the sweet touches she provided that were unexpectedly delightful, we were just delighted. We loved the large stand-alone tub, the private porch area where we enjoyed our morning coffee (it was like being in a hidden forest!), the cozy bed... it was just a darling place all around.
We went to a concert at the Gorge and drove to Wenatchee following the show -- the drive took about an hour and 15 minutes but it was worth it (and so much better than driving back to Seattle late at night!). We will definitely book again the next time we go to the Gorge or need a place to stay in Wenatchee.

review_text: Traci is the most generous and welcoming host I have experienced on Airbnb so far. She was quick to get in touch with me and so friendly, and her space is absolutely gorgeous. She provided some bath salts and bath essentials for her beautiful claw foot soaking tub, and many other thoughtful touches in the space like an oil diffuser that really make a difference when you need to recuperate from travel. The bed was very comfortable and the whole cabin had a lovely unmistakable cedar smell, truly living up to its name. Itâ€™s the perfect little getaway cabin, very quiet and secluded with a nice little porch as well to sit out on. Wifi is fast and check in was easy with a code. I like to meet my hosts when I travel and it so happened we were going to the same concert and Traci was kind enough to invite me to meet up and that really has made my stay in Wenatchee extra special as I was travelling alone. Itâ€™s rare to encounter people like her! But even if you just want a getaway and your own privacy, I highly recommend her place. I will definitely be returning.

name: Peggy

Rating, 5 stars

July 2021
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
What a beautiful space you have created, Traci.
Sometimes AirBnB stays are in a place that feels a bit run-down; not so here. This felt like staying in the guest bedroom of a very nice home, complete with beautiful art and tasteful decor. The absolutely decedent bathroom was a delight, with a soaking tub and extra-plush towels. Loved her iron tree branch sculptures, and all the little touches she put into the room. Excellent hospitality.
The one thing I will note is, I failed to notice there isn't actually a shower. I was in town for work and it was very hot (July) - normally I would take a quick shower but that was not an option, and it felt a little wasteful to fill the big tub during a drought unless I was going to use it. All in all that was very minor thing and I made do - and the flip side is, I did take full advantage of the tub, too, when I had time to enjoy it! At the end of a long day, a nice soak felt so great!
The tranquil back patio and the gorgeously landscaped property felt secluded and private - like being in my own forest retreat, with lit trails through the trees. A+, would definitely stay here again.

I recently had the pleasure of staying at the delightful Airbnb property hosted by Dawn. From the moment we arrived until the day of departure, every aspect of our stay was nothing short of exceptional. Finally, the highlight of my stay was the wonderful, meaningful conversation with Dawn along with her delicious hearty breakfast â€”such a delightful and unexpected touch. Highly recommend this host for a fantastic and welcoming experience!

We would highly recommend Dawn's place for a true bed & breakfast experience while you are visiting the Wenatchee area.

review_text:
My teenage son and I stayed here while visiting local family. Rachael was an excellent communicator - I had several questions and she always responded very quickly and helpfully. The house was easy to find, and we had a code to get in through a private entry. Even my son said â€œwow this is really nice!â€ when we opened the door to the space. It was like a cool studio apartment. There was a little electric fireplace and a small kitchen with a fridge, cooktop, microwave/convection oven, and Keurig coffee maker with a ton of options (including cocoa). We really appreciated the snacks and enjoyed playing board games. There were so many nice little touches and even a portable crib for folks traveling with a smaller kiddo. We had forgotten something so we needed to run to the store and there was a WinCo within a half mile or so - we walked there after dark and felt very safe.
All in all just a great visit and we will definitely stay here again if we need a place in Wenatchee!

review_text:
My two sons (10 and 13) and I thorouhly enjoyed our stay! We all loved the spa-like bathroom! It's what I would describe as very sensory-friendly for anybody with special needs (ASD, anxeity). It's clean, lighting can be adjusted (sliders to turn down brightness), and it has a private entrance. The hostess went out of her way to make the apt. feel like home, with personalizations and treats. Kids enjoyed the snack bars, I enjoyed the goat-milk soap!
I also think this location is especially nice for North Wenatchee - the senior center is around the corner and beyond that is a school field, so any sports enthusiasts or joggers would love having a soccer/baseball field "right there". I totally felt safe having my kids walk around in the neighborhood by themselves. They could go down Maple (there are sidewalks) and walk around/across the sportsfield during daylight hours.
Thanks, Rachael! We'll be back.

Stayed with kids
review_text: Rachael has created a beautiful space out of her basement. The bathroom is especially modern, warm and luxuriously spacious. The only reason for our 4-star rating is that it was listed as a 1 bedroom but it is actually a studio. Only the bathroom has a separate space. We travel with our young child and having a separate bedroom for her to fall asleep in allows us to have some time to watch tv, play a game and/or just hang out and talk. Instead, staying in a studio means we have to go to bed when she does and all rise together. It was probably good for us to get the added rest, but we definitely thought we were booking something different and were disappointed by the inaccuracy. Highly recommend this space for a solo individual or a couple, though, if you happen to be staying in Wenatchee. Otherwise, it was lovely and the keyless entry allows you to check-in without needing to coordinate a meetup and the design of the space never makes you feel like you are staying below someoneâ€™s home.

Highly recommend! Would stay again!

September 2019
,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text: Staying at Rachael and Charlie's house was an amazing experience. I only saw Charlie and Molly (their dog) and during that time Charlie gave me some good local tips and drove me to the airport at 5 AM! I asked if there was a taxi service I could use, and he seemed to know that it wouldn't be possible so he offered to drive me with Molly! His hospitality was a highlight of my trip to Washington. I felt more than welcome and would absolutely suggest this stay to tired travelers. (They also offered some nice handmade sample soaps/lotions for washing) I'd take this over a hotel any day!
